medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset epigastric pain associated with nonbloody emesis and hypotension.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began suddenly with epigastric pain. The patient experienced nonbloody emesis twice and hypotension.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Nonischemic dilated cardiomyopathy, hypertension, DM2 A1c 8.0, Hyperlipidemia, Hepatitis B, paroxysmal atrial fibrillation on Coumadin, history of left ventricular wall thrombus with completed anticoagulation treatment, and history of pulmonary embolism arrest following beta-blocker administration.
medical_history.family_history: His parents and siblings have type 2 diabetes, and his brother had coronary artery disease diagnosed at an unspecified age.
